questions.question: What is climate change?

choices.answer: An increase in temps due to the release of greenhouse gases.
The natural increase in overall global temperatures.
A decrease in global temperatures due to the escape of heat.
A decrease in global temps due to improving emissions.

questions.question: What are the four main greenhouse gases?

choices.answer: Carbon Dioxide, Methane, Nitrous Oxide, CFC's

questions.question: What is a fossil fuel?

choices.answer: Any combustible organic material derived from fossils.

questions.question: Name the TOP 3 countries in terms of greenhouse gas emissions.
What are two observable impacts of climate change?

choices.answer: Sea level change, Coral reef bleaching
Sea level decrease, an increase in La Nina events
Growing season increase, snow frost decrease

questions.question: How will climate change effect equatorial regions?

choices.answer: Rising sea levels and increased inundation
Rainfall and air temperatures will change

questions.question: Name the four open ‘physical’ systems.
The Earth is a closed system, which means that resources are_______.
What is the importance of the carbon cycle?

choices.answer: The level of CO2 in the atmosphere regulates world temp.
Carbon should be removed to prevent the greenhouse effect.
Oceans should not absorb CO2 - it is bad for fauna and flora
The carbon cycle will run out of power if not protected.

questions.question: What is the El Nino phenomena, relation to Australia?

choices.answer: A reversal of the normal weather pattern; brings drought.
An exaggeration of the normal weather pattern; brings floods

questions.question: What is the La Nina phenomenon?

choices.answer: An exaggeration of normal weather patterns; brings floods
A reversal of normal weather patterns; brings droughts.

questions.question: Historically, what is the normal period of time between El Nino events?
How does the advanced greenhouse effect come about? (GG = Greenhouse Gases)

choices.answer: A lower amount of GG in the atmosphere, decreasing temps.
A natural process that the Earth phases through.
A result of increasing solar flares.
A higher amount of GG in the atmosphere, increasing temps.

questions.question: What are the three main human causes of climate change?

choices.answer: Renewable Energy, Air Pollution, Removal of Vegetation
Emissions, Air Pollution, Removal of Vegetation

questions.question: Which one of the following is an ECONOMIC impact of climate change?

choices.answer: Rising costs of coping with adaption

questions.question: Which one of the following is a SOCIAL impact of climate change?
What climate change agreement did Donald Trump pull the USA out of?
What is passive solar design?

choices.answer: Sustainable housing design that utilises the suns' energy.
A mechanical systems that moves heat around the home.

questions.question: What island nation will be the first to disappear under rising sea levels?
What is the predicted average temperature rise across the globe (end of the century)?
